intro: Sphaeranthus elongatus, commonly known as the slender globe flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters, giving it its common name. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Sphaeranthus elongatus is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
